original: Karlberg, Sven Oskar Wilhelm, fd. överste, Skövde, f. 9/1/78 i Gbg av kapt. Oskar K. o. Maria Åhlén. G. 06 m. Kerstin Sjöberg, d. 29. Barn: Ulla f. 09, g. m. dir. S. H. Sjöholm, Paris, Elsa 10, g. m. apot. T. Setter-gren, Skövde. — Und :löjtn. v. Västg. reg. 99, löjtn. 02, und :intend. v. in-tend :kåren 04, intend. 05, ’kapt. 15, major 19, tjg. i franska armén 21, öv:-löjtn. 23, överste 26, chef f. arméför-valtn. intend :dep. utrustn :byrå s. å. Led. av riksvärder :nd 27, nämndeman i Skövde tiingsfegs häradsrätt 38. Hob-bies: bokbinderi o. vävning. KSOlkl, RVO, KFinlVRO, RNS:tOOrkl, Land-st :SM, LKrVA.
translated: Karlberg, Sven Oskar Wilhelm, retired colonel, Skövde, born on 9/1/1878 in Gothenburg, son of Captain Oskar K. and Maria Åhlén. Married in 1906 to Kerstin Sjöberg, passed away on 29th. Children: Ulla born in 1909, married to director S. H. Sjöholm, Paris, Elsa born in 1910, married to apothecary T. Settergren, Skövde. Formerly: second lieutenant of Västergötland regiment, 1899, lieutenant, 1902, lieutenant in the intendance corps, 1904, intendant, 1905, captain, 1915, major, 1919, served in the French army in 1921, lieutenant colonel, 1923, colonel, 1926, chief of the army administration intendance department, same year. Member of the National Valuation Board since 1927, lay judge in the Skövde district court in 1938. Hobbies: bookbinding and weaving. Knight of the Order of the Seraphim (KSO), Knight of the Royal Swedish Order of the Sword (RVO), Knight of the Order of the White Rose of Finland (KFinlVRO), Knight of the Order of the Norwegian Lion (RNS:tO), Knight of the National Medal of War (LKrVA).

awards.name: Royal Swedish Order of the Sword
Order of the White Rose of Finland
